item.title: Creating 100s of NTFS permissions with Powershell
item.description: Starting at my new employer one of the first major projects to hit implementation phase is a migration of the company file server. The major wrinkle is that the old file server is on Novell, with 25+ years of permission and folder buildup. The normal Windows to Windows robocopy won’t work to preserve permissions, all permissions must be mapped from Novell OUs, Groups, & Users to AD OUs, Groups, & Users and subsequently applied to the newly copied files on a Windows file server.

item.title: My First Post
item.description: Soon to be the home of content.
